info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 9:19PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks County through 945 PM EDT... At 918 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Adamstown, or 9 miles south of Reading, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Laureldale, New Morgan, Shillington, West Reading, Mount Penn, Mohnton, Kenhorst, St. Lawrence, Lorane, Reiffton, Amity Gardens, West Wyomissing, Flying Hills, Wyomissing Hills and West Lawn. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 295 and 298. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
